attributes.action: Make it compulsory to show ‘Jesy Nelson: Odd One Out’ in all secondary schools
attributes.additional_details: This should be compulsory across the UK in all secondary schools. Everyone should be aware of the impact their words and actions can cause, and I believe they will be more understanding if it is said by a public figure and somebody that young adults can relate to.
attributes.background: More and more kids/young adults are being attacked and targeted on social media platforms and we want to show the impact that this can have on kids and young adults.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

The educational materials used to teach school students is a matter for individual schools, not the Government or House of Commons.

You might like to sign the following petitions:

Stop Bullying in Schools by Training All Teachers to spot Bullying & Harassment
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560462

Fund a national awareness campaign for mental health in schools
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553711

Provide additional funding to schools for Y10-13 mental health support.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548678
